name: 3D-Beacons
description: Network providing unified programmatic access to experimentally determined and predicted structure models

name: Access to Biological Collection Data Schema (ABCD)
description: A standard schema for primary biodiversity data

name: Ada Discovery Analytics (Ada)
description: Ada is a performant and highly configurable system for secured integration, visualization, and collaborative analysis of heterogeneous data sets, primarily targeting clinical and experimental sources.

name: Addgene
description: A searchable repository with a focus on plasmids

name: AgroPortal
description: Browser for ontologies for agricultural science based on NBCO BioPortal.

name: Amazon Web Services
description: Amazon Web Services

name: Amnesia
description: Amnesia is a GDPR compliant high accuracy data anonymization tool

name: AOP4EUpest
description: AOP4EUpest web server is devoted to the identification of pesticides involved in an Adverse Outcome Pathway via text mining approaches.

name: APID Interactomes

name: Argos
description: Plan and follow your data. Bring your Data Management Plans closer to where data are generated, analysed and stored.

name: ArrayExpress
description: A repository of array based genomics data

name: Arvados
description: With Arvados, bioinformaticians run and scale compute-intensive workflows, developers create biomedical applications, and IT administrators manage large compute and storage resources.

name: Aspera Fasp
description: With fast file transfer and streaming solutions built on the award-winning IBM FASP protocol, IBM Aspera software moves data of any size across any distance

name: ATCC
description: Biological materials resource including cell-lines, strains and genomics tools

name: Atlas
description: Free, publicly available web-based, open-source software application developed by the OHDSI community to support the design and execution of observational analyses to generate real world evidence from patient level observational data.

name: b2share
description: Store and publish your research data. Can be used to bridge between domains

name: BacDive
description: A searchable database for bacteria specific information

name: Bacillus Genetic Stock Center (BGSC)
description: A repository specific to Bacillus strains

name: BASE

name: BBMRI-ERIC's ELSI Knowledge Base
description: The ELSI Knowledge Base is an open-access resource platform that aims at providing practical know-how for responsible research.

name: Beacon
description: The Beacon protocol defines an open standard for genomics data discovery.

name: Benchling
description: R&D Platform for Life Sciences

name: BIAFLOWS
description: BIAFLOWS is an open-soure web framework to reproducibly deploy and benchmark bioimage analysis workflows

name: BigNASim

name: BIII

name: BindingDB

name: Bio-Formats

name: Bioconda

name: Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG)
description: Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG), historically the Taxonomic Databases Working Group, work to develop biodiversity information standards

name: BioExcel COVID-19

name: BioImageArchive

name: BioModels
description: A repository of mathematical models for application in biological sciences

name: BIONDA

name: BioSamples

name: Bioschemas

name: BioStudies
description: A database hosting datasets from biological studies. Useful for storing or accessing data that is not compliant for mainstream repositories.

name: BisQue
description: Resource for management and analysis of 5D biological images

name: Bitbucket

name: BMRB

name: BoostDM

name: Box

name: BrAPI

name: BRENDA

name: Bulk Rename Utility

name: CalibraCurve
description: A highly useful and flexible tool for calibration of targeted MS?based measurements. CalibraCurve enables an automated batch-mode determination of dynamic linear ranges and quantification limits for both targeted proteomics and similar assays. The software uses a variety of measures to assess the accuracy of the calibration and provides intuitive visualizations.

name: CAMEO
description: Continuous evaluation of the accuracy and reliability of protein structure prediction methods in a fully automated manner

name: Cancer Genome Interpreter
description: Cancer Genome Interpreter (CGI) is designed to support the identification of tumor alterations that drive the disease and detect those that may be therapeutically actionable.

name: CAPRI
description: Critical assessment of structure prediction methods for protein-protein interactions

name: CAS Registry
description: The CAS Registry (Chemical Abstracts Service Registry) includes more than 188 million unique chemicals. CAS Registry Numbers are broadly used as a unique identifier for chemical substances. The Registry is maintained by CAS, a subdivision of the American Chemical Society.

name: CASP
description: Biennial critical assessment of techniques for protein structure prediction

name: Castor
description: Castor is an EDC system for researchers and institutions. With Castor, you can create and customize your own database in no time. Without any prior technical knowledge, you can build a study in just a few clicks using our intuitive Form Builder. Simply define your data points and start collecting high quality data, all you need is a web browser.

name: CATH
description: A hierarchical domain classification of protein structures in the Protein Data Bank.

name: CEDAR
description: CEDAR is making data submission smarter and faster, so that scientific researchers and analysts can create and use better metadata.

name: CellRepo

name: Cellular Microscopy Phenotype Ontology (CMPO)
description: An ontology for expressing cellular (or multi-cellular) terms with applications in microscopy

name: CERNBox

name: ChEBI
description: Dictionary of molecular entities focused on 'small' chemical compounds

name: ChEMBL

name: ChIPSummitDB

It is a part of a suite of databases and web applications developed by the US Environmental Protection Agency's Chemical Safety for Sustainability Research Program. These databases and apps support EPA's computational toxicology research efforts to develop innovative methods to change how chemicals are currently evaluated for potential health risks.

description: EUDAT's wizard for finding the right licence for your data or code.

description: The European database of suspected adverse drug reaction reports is a public resource aimed to provide access to reported suspected side-effects of drugs. Side-effects are defined according to the MedDRA ontology.

name: EUPID
description: EUPID provides a method for identity management, pseudonymisation and record linkage to bridge the gap between multiple contexts.

name: EURISCO

name: European Joint Programme on Rare Diseases (EJP RD)
description: A programme aiming to create an effective rare diseases research ecosystem for progress, innovation and for the benefit of everyone with a rare disease.

name: European Joint Programme on Rare Diseases Metadata Model
description: This core model is designed to represent data about a rare disease patient and biosample registries. The model is based on and builds on existing standards, such as the European Rare Disease Registry Infrastructure and the Common Data Elements from the rare disease community and other more generalised standards for data sharing such as the W3C DCAT vocabulary.

name: European Joint Programme on Rare Diseases Virtual Platform (EJP RD)
description: The Virtual Platform is a federated ecosystem, in which resources are enhanced to be amenable to rare disease research, and made Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable: data stays at the source level but can be queyrable at distance from an EJP RD query point.

name: European Nucleotide Archive (ENA)
description: A record of sequence information scaling from raw sequcning reads to assemblies and functional annotation

name: European Rare Disease Registry Infrastructure directory of registries (ERDRI.dor)
description: ERDRI.dor provides an overview of participating rare disease registries with their main characteristics and description.

name: European Rare Disease Registry Infrastructure metadata repository (ERDRI.mdr)
description: ERDRI.mdr serves to ease the integration of heterogeneous data from different rare disease registries. For this purpose, it contains a collection of metadata which specifies the used data elements of a registry including the designation of the used data elements, their definition and units of measurement.

name: European Reference Networks (ERNs)
description: Virtual networks involving healthcare providers across Europe. They aim to facilitate discussion on complex or rare diseases and conditions that require highly specialised treatment, and concentrated knowledge and resources.

name: European Variation Archive (EVA)
description: Open-access database of all types of genetic variation data from all species.

name: Evidence and Conclusion Ontology (ECO)
description: Controlled vocabulary that describes types of evidence and assertion methods

name: FAERS
description: The FDA Adverse Event Reporting System (FAERS) is an american resource that contains adverse event reports, medication error reports and product quality complaints submitted by healthcare professionals, consumers, and manufacturers. MedDRA ontology is used for coding adverse effects. Note that reports available in FAERS do not require a causal relationship between a product and an adverse event and further evaluations are conducted by FDA to monitor the safety of products.

name: FAIDARE
description: FAIDARE is a tool allowing to search data across dinstinct databases that implemented BrAPI.

name: FAIR Cookbook
description: FAIR Cookbook is an online resource for the Life Sciences with recipes that help you to make and keep data Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable (FAIR)

name: FAIR Data Point (FDP)
description: A FAIR Data Point stores metadata in a standardized and sharable way.

name: FAIR Evaluation Services

name: FAIR Implementation Profile
description: The FIP is a collection of FAIR implementation choices made by a community of practice for each of the FAIR Principles.

name: GenBank
description: A database of genetic sequence information. GenBank may also refer to the data format used for storing information around genetic sequence data.

description: A repository of MIAME-compliant genomics data from arrays and high-throughput sequencing

name: GENEID

name: GHS Classification
description: GHS (Globally Harmonized System of Classification and Labelling of Chemicals) classification was developed by the United Nations in an attempt to align standards and chemical regulations in different countries. GHS includes criteria for the classification of health, physical and environmental hazards, and what information should be included on labels of hazardous chemicals and safety data sheets.

name: Git
description: Distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects

name: GitHub
description: Versioning system, used for sharing code, as well as for sharing of small data

name: GitLab
description: GitLab is an open source end-to-end software development platform with built-in version control, issue tracking, code review, CI/CD, and more. Self-host GitLab on your own servers, in a container, or on a cloud provider.

name: Globus
description: Globus lets you efficiently, securely, and reliably transfer data directly between systems separated by an office wall or an ocean. Focus on your research and offload your data transfer headaches to Globus

name: GnpIS
description: A multispecies integrative information system dedicated to plant and fungi pests. It allows researchers to access genetic, phenotypic and genomic data. It is used by both large international projects and the French National Research Institute for Agriculture, Food and Environment.

name: Google Dataset Search
description: Search engine for datasets

name: Google Drive
description: Cloud Storage for Work and Home

name: GPCRmd

name: GRAPE 2.0

name: Harvard Medical School - ELN Comparison Grid
description: ELN Comparison Grid by Hardvard Medical School

name: Haz-Map
description: Haz-Map is an occupational health database that makes available information about the adverse effects of exposures to chemical and biological agents at the workplace. These associations have been established using current scientific evidence.

name: How to License Research Data - DCC

name: Human Protein Atlas

description: HumanMine integrates many types of human data and provides a powerful query engine, export for results, analysis for lists of data and FAIR access via web services.

description: A repository of image datasets from scientific publications

name: Keycloak

name: LimTox
description: The LiMTox system is a text mining approach that tries to extract associations between compounds and a particular toxicological endpoint at various levels of granularity and evidence types, all inspired by the content of toxicology reports. It integrates direct ranking of associations between compounds and hepatotoxicity through combination of heterogeneous complementary strategies from term co-mention, rules, and patterns to machine learning-based text classification. It also provides indirect associations to hepatotoxicity through the extraction of relations reflecting the effect of compounds at the level of metabolism and liver enzymes.

name: Linked Open Vocabularies (LOV)
description: Web portal for finding ontologies

name: List of Prokaryotic names with Standing in Nomenclature (LPSN)

name: LUMI

name: maDMP - Research Bridge
description: Machine-Actionable Data Management Plan | Webinar (2016) on making a good data management plan.

name: MarDB

name: MarFun
description: MarFun is a manually curated marine fungi genome database.

name: MemProtMD
